name: tck2connectome
description:
Generate a connectome matrix from a streamlines file and a node parcellation image.



References:

If using the default streamline-parcel assignment mechanism (or -assignment_radial_search option): Smith, R. E.; Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. The effects of SIFT on the reproducibility and biological accuracy of the structural connectome. NeuroImage, 2015, 104, 253-265

If using -scale_invlength or -scale_invnodevol options: Hagmann, P.; Cammoun, L.; Gigandet, X.; Meuli, R.; Honey, C.; Wedeen, V. & Sporns, O. Mapping the Structural Core of Human Cerebral Cortex. PLoS Biology 6(7), e159
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au)

inputs.name: tracks_in
inputs.description: the input track file

inputs.name: nodes_in
inputs.description: the input node parcellation image

inputs.name: connectome_out
inputs.description: the output .csv file containing edge weights

inputs.name: assignment_end_voxels
inputs.description: use a simple voxel lookup value at each streamline endpoint

inputs.name: assignment_radial_search
inputs.description: perform a radial search from each streamline endpoint to locate the nearest node. Argument is the maximum radius in mm; if no node is found within this radius, the streamline endpoint is not assigned to any node. Default search distance is 4mm.

inputs.name: assignment_reverse_search
inputs.description: traverse from each streamline endpoint inwards along the streamline, in search of the last node traversed by the streamline. Argument is the maximum traversal length in mm (set to 0 to allow search to continue to the streamline midpoint).

inputs.name: assignment_forward_search
inputs.description: project the streamline forwards from the endpoint in search of a parcellation node voxel. Argument is the maximum traversal length in mm.

inputs.name: assignment_all_voxels
inputs.description: assign the streamline to all nodes it intersects along its length (note that this means a streamline may be assigned to more than two nodes, or indeed none at all)

inputs.name: scale_length
inputs.description: scale each contribution to the connectome edge by the length of the streamline

inputs.name: scale_invlength
inputs.description: scale each contribution to the connectome edge by the inverse of the streamline length

inputs.name: scale_invnodevol
inputs.description: scale each contribution to the connectome edge by the inverse of the two node volumes

inputs.name: scale_file
inputs.description: scale each contribution to the connectome edge according to the values in a vector file

inputs.name: symmetric
inputs.description: Make matrices symmetric on output

inputs.name: zero_diagonal
inputs.description: Set matrix diagonal to zero on output

inputs.name: stat_edge
inputs.description: statistic for combining the values from all streamlines in an edge into a single scale value for that edge (options are: sum,mean,min,max; default=sum)

inputs.name: tck_weights_in
inputs.description: specify a text scalar file containing the streamline weights

inputs.name: keep_unassigned
inputs.description: By default, the program discards the information regarding those streamlines that are not successfully assigned to a node pair. Set this option to keep these values (will be the first row/column in the output matrix)

inputs.name: out_assignments
inputs.description: output the node assignments of each streamline to a file; this can be used subsequently e.g. by the command connectome2tck

inputs.name: vector
inputs.description: output a vector representing connectivities from a given seed point to target nodes, rather than a matrix of node-node connectivities

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.

output-files.name: connectome_out
output-files.description: the output .csv file containing edge weights

output-files.name: out_assignments
output-files.description: output the node assignments of each streamline to a file; this can be used subsequently e.g. by the command connectome2tck
